intro: Heliophytum lithospermifolium, commonly known as the rock-plantain sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many other succulent plants. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it a valuable species for xeriscaping and ecological restoration.
